name: MessageStore
documentation:
A low-level store for serialized messages.

This interface defines an append-only log used to store {@link SerializedMessage} instances, typically representing commands, events, queries, or other domain messages. It supports batched retrieval and allows integration with in-memory or persistent message tracking implementations.

The {@code MessageStore} plays a central role in Fluxzero's tracking and message handling infrastructure. In testing, in-memory implementations of {@code MessageStore} are used to simulate Fluxzero Runtime behavior.

This interface is also {@link Monitored}, allowing hooks to observe message publication, and extends {@link HasMessageStore} so it can expose itself as a reusable component. @see SerializedMessage @see Monitored @see HasMessageStore

append
close
methods.documentation: Default no-op close method. Override if resources need cleanup.

getMessageStore
